ai-mn116:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Isigili Mountain.
ai-mn116:2.1_0: “Mendicants, do you see that Mount Vebhāra?”
ai-mn116:2.3_0: “It used to have a different label and description.
ai-mn116:2.4_0: Do you see that Mount Paṇḍava?”
ai-mn116:2.6_0: “It too used to have a different label and description.
ai-mn116:2.7_0: Do you see that Mount Vepulla?”
ai-mn116:2.9_0: “It too used to have a different label and description.
ai-mn116:2.10_0: Do you see that Mount Vulture’s Peak?”
ai-mn116:2.12_0: “It too used to have a different label and description.
ai-mn116:2.13_0: Do you see that Mount Isigili?”
ai-mn116:3.1_0: “It used to have exactly the same label and description.
ai-mn116:3.2_0: Once upon a time, five hundred Buddhas awakened for themselves dwelt for a long time on this Isigili.
ai-mn116:3.3_0: They were seen entering the mountain, but after entering were seen no more.
ai-mn116:3.4_0: When people saw him they said,
ai-mn116:3.6_0: That’s how it came to be known as Isigili.
ai-mn116:3.7_0: I shall declare the names of the Buddhas awakened for themselves;
ai-mn116:3.8_0: I shall extol the names of the Buddhas awakened for themselves;
ai-mn116:3.9_0: I shall teach the names of the Buddhas awakened for themselves.
ai-mn116:3.10_0: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn116:4.1_0: “The Buddhas awakened for themselves who dwelt for a long time on this Isigili were named Ariṭṭha,
ai-mn116:4.8_0: Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja awakened for themselves who dwelt for a long time on this Isigili.
ai-mn116:4.11_0: Mendicants, your awakened for themselves who dwelt for a long time on this Isigili were named Ariṭṭha,
ai-mn116:5.1_0: Those saintly beings, untroubled and free of hope,
ai-mn116:5.4_0: the supreme persons, free of thorns.
ai-mn116:6.3_0: awakened for themselves, enders of the attachment to rebirth.
ai-mn116:6.5_0: Two sages named Jāli, and Aṭṭhaka.
ai-mn116:6.6_0: Then the Buddha Kosala and Subāhu;
ai-mn116:6.8_0: right and true, stainless and astute.
ai-mn116:6.9_0: Kāḷa and Upakāḷa, Vijita and Jita,
ai-mn116:6.10_0: Aṅga and Paṅga, and Guttijita too;
ai-mn116:6.11_0: Passin gave up attachment, suffering’s root,
ai-mn116:6.15_0: Manomaya, and Bandhumant the cutter of conceit,
ai-mn116:6.16_0: and Tadādhimutta the immaculate and resplendent.
ai-mn116:6.22_0: another sage, Sayha of peerless effort.
ai-mn116:6.23_0: There are twelve Ānandas, Nandas, and Upanandas,
ai-mn116:6.24_0: the lord of the supreme beings.
ai-mn116:6.27_0: Tissa and Upatissa, who’ve both cut the bonds to rebirth,
ai-mn116:6.28_0: Upasīdarin and Sīdarin, who’ve both cut off craving.
ai-mn116:6.29_0: Maṅgala was awakened, free of greed,
ai-mn116:6.30_0: Usabha cut the net, the root of suffering,
ai-mn116:6.31_0: Upanīta who attained the state of peace,
ai-mn116:6.35_0: Mānatthaddha, beautiful and free of greed,
ai-mn116:6.36_0: and the Buddha Kaṇha, his mind well freed.
ai-mn116:7.1_0: These and other mighty ones awakened for themselves,
ai-mn116:7.2_0: enders of the attachment to rebirth—
ai-mn116:7.3_0: honor these great hermits who are fully extinguished,
ai-mn116:7.5_0: The sixth section on the Black Rock is finished.
